Package view

Class ToolBarHandler

java.lang.Object
view.ToolBarHandler
public class ToolBarHandler extends Object
The ToolBarHandler class is responsible for creating and managing the toolbar used in the application. It provides functionality for undo and redo operations, font size adjustments, notebook management, and theme changes.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ToolBarHandler(JFrame frame, JTextArea noteTextArea)
    Constructs a new ToolBarHandler with the specified frame and text area.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    JToolBar
    createToolBar()
    Creates and returns a JToolBar equipped with buttons for undo and redo operations, a font size slider, an autosave toggle, and a notebook selection button.
    void
    displayNotebookList()
    Displays a dialog containing a list of notebooks, allowing the user to select an existing one or create a new one.
    void
    redo()
    Performs a redo operation if available.
    void
    setExitTouchScreenModeButton(JButton button)
    Sets the button for exiting touch screen mode.
    void
    undo()
    Performs an undo operation if available.

  • Constructor Details

    • ToolBarHandler

      public ToolBarHandler(JFrame frame, JTextArea noteTextArea)
      Constructs a new ToolBarHandler with the specified frame and text area.
      Parameters:
      frame - The main application frame
      noteTextArea - The text area where notes are displayed and edited

  • Method Details

    • createToolBar

      public JToolBar createToolBar()
      Creates and returns a JToolBar equipped with buttons for undo and redo operations, a font size slider, an autosave toggle, and a notebook selection button.
      Returns:
      The fully configured toolbar

    • setExitTouchScreenModeButton

      public void setExitTouchScreenModeButton(JButton button)
      Sets the button for exiting touch screen mode. This button is not visible until set by this method.
      Parameters:
      button - The button used to exit touch screen mode

    • undo

      public void undo()
      Performs an undo operation if available.

      public void redo()
      Performs a redo operation if available.

    • displayNotebookList

      public void displayNotebookList()
      Displays a dialog containing a list of notebooks, allowing the user to select an existing one or create a new one.
